thread.title_full: Get them to the geeks! British Airways to launch direct route to Silicon Valley with brand new Dreamliners featuring the latest first class cabins | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Get them to the geeks! British Airways to launch direct route to Silicon Valley with brand new Dreamliners featuring the latest first class cabins
text:
5 shares
View
comments
Hackers, venture capitalists and software developers alike will be thrilled to hear that British Airways has just announced plans for a new, direct route between London and San Jose, California.
Located right in the middle of Silicon Valley, the city of San Jose is considered the capital of the high-tech region, with Mineta San Jose International Airport airport serving some of the United States' most successful entrepreneurs.
And with fares starting at just £499 return, it's not just the Mark Zuckerbergs of the world who will be able to afford the service.
Scroll down for video
British Airways' new flight route will be the first direct journey servicing Europe and San Jose (pictured)
San Jose is the world's software power-house, with such tech giants such as Adobe, Cisco, eBay and Intel calling the city home.
In fact, just a 20 minute drive will take travellers from the airport hub to both Apple and Google headquarters. And in 30 minutes, developers will be able to reach Facebook's infamous head office at 1 Hacker Way.

The new route will also undoubtedly prove beneficial to Stanford University students, since their university is situated less than 20 miles away.
Daily flights will begin in May 2016 - the first and only service between Europe and San Jose - marking the airline's fourth California destination.
The flight time will be 10 hours and 50 minutes.
The Mineta San Jose International Airport is conveniently located just 40 minutes from Stanford University
As one might expect from the route servicing some of the world's biggest software power-houses, the company will utilise their brand new 787-9 Dreamliner, featuring British Airways' very latest First class cabin.
There will be eight of the coveted seats available, as well as 42 seats in Club World, 39 in World Traveller Plus and 127 in World Traveller.
Return fares will range from £499 to £3,675.
Not too bad, considering that the British Airways 787-9 Dreamliner, which will make its first commercial flight from Heathrow to Delhi in October, will be the most technologically advanced aircraft in the company's fleet.
San Jose is considered the capital city of Silicon Valley, where plenty of high-tech companies and start-ups have developed, such as Facebook
San Jose is also a great spot for travellers to set out from to visit the central Californian coast. Pictured: Carmel
Stephen Humphreys, British Airways, head of global sales, said: 'There's no better place to fly the world's most advanced passenger aircraft than to the world's home of hi-tech and innovation, San Jose.
'Our new daily service will offer fantastic direct flights between Silicon Valley and London, with onward connections to scores of destinations around the globe on our extensive world-wide network.
'We're sure this new service will prove just the business for Californian-based companies looking to expand into Europe and will strengthen London's strong commercial ties with the West Coast.
'It also offers a brilliant starting point for visitors to nearby Carmel and Monterey on the rugged central coast along highway one, and easy access to the unrivalled splendour of Yosemite National Park.'
Yosemite National Park is also quite close to San Jose and is popular among international visitors
Sam Liccardo, mayor of San Jose, said: 'San Jose and Silicon Valley tech companies have committed to Mineta San Jose International as being their airport of choice, and have expressed strong support for a direct flight to London for several years.
'British Airways' announcement to launch services between San Jose and London Heathrow will be well received by both business and leisure travellers in our region.'
Kim Becker, Mineta San José International Airport's director of aviation, said: 'London is the number one requested international destination from Mineta San Jose International Airport, and we're so pleased to share the news today that we have delivered this service to Silicon Valley businesses and residents.'
